Key Match Events: Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan started well but lost wickets and took a few too many balls to get going
Mohammad Amir and Naseem Shah bowled really well, particularly Naseem who stood out
India's last hope, Hardik Pandya could not do much, resulting in India posting just 119 on the board
Jasprit Bumrah was the PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his game-changing spell
India defeated Pakistan by 6 runs in a low-scoring thriller
Rohit Sharma and Babar Azam both fell early, leading to a collapse of the Indian top order
Pakistan were unable to capitalize on the early wickets and India built a solid platform
Pre-Game Insights: India needed to string partnerships which they did not
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were set to open the innings for India
Pakistan had four fast bowlers and were ready for the clash
The captain of India, Rohit Sharma mentioned that they would look to assess as quickly as possible and try to get a decent score
The captain of Pakistan, Babar Azam mentioned that they would bowl first given the weather and pitch conditions
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma said that they did not bat well enough and fell 15-20 runs short
Babar Azam said that they bowled well after the first 10 overs and would have taken 120 at the start
Jasprit Bumrah said that it feels really good to get the win and that the key was to keep things simple
Miscellaneous Highlights: There was a big collapse in the latter part of the innings as the middle order crumbled
The Indian bowlers, particularly Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya, and Axar Patel, performed well
The pitch was described as a bit slow and much better in general
The match was described as a thrilling low-scoring contest
